articles.headline: Israeli Hostage Says She Was Sexually Assaulted and Tortured in Gaza
articles.snippet: Amit Soussana is the first former hostage to publicly say she was sexually abused in captivity. A U.N. report has said it found “clear and convincing information” that some hostages suffered “conflict-related sexual violence.”
articles.abstract: Amit Soussana is the first former hostage to publicly say she was sexually abused in captivity. A U.N. report has said it found “clear and convincing information” that some hostages suffered “conflict-related sexual violence.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Amit Soussana, an Israeli lawyer, was abducted from her home on Oct. 7, beaten and dragged into Gaza by at least 10 men, some armed. Several days into her captivity, she said, her guard began asking about her sex life.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley and Ronen Bergman

articles.headline: NBC News Cuts Ties With Ronna McDaniel After Network Firestorm
articles.snippet: A string of top stars had denounced the hiring of Ms. McDaniel, the former chairwoman of the Republican National Committee, on their own airwaves.
articles.abstract: A string of top stars had denounced the hiring of Ms. McDaniel, the former chairwoman of the Republican National Committee, on their own airwaves.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Ronna McDaniel era at NBC News has come to an abrupt and chaotic end.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: Rescue Effort Turns Into Search for Bodies of 6 Workers on the Bridge
articles.snippet: Questions swirl over the bridge’s collapse after a massive cargo ship slammed into the Francis Scott Key Bridge moments after losing power early on Tuesday.
articles.abstract: Questions swirl over the bridge’s collapse after a massive cargo ship slammed into the Francis Scott Key Bridge moments after losing power early on Tuesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a spring tide rushed out of Baltimore harbor just after midnight on Tuesday, the hulking outlines of a cargo ship nearly three football fields long and stacked high with thousands of containers sliced through frigid waters toward the Francis Scott Key Bridge.

articles.headline: Filmmaker Draws Censors’ Wrath: ‘A Price I Have to Accept’
articles.snippet: Wang Xiaoshuai is among the few Chinese artists who refuse to bend to state limitations on the subjects they explore.
articles.abstract: Wang Xiaoshuai is among the few Chinese artists who refuse to bend to state limitations on the subjects they explore.
articles.lead_paragraph: China’s film industry was operating under a planned economy when Wang Xiaoshuai graduated from Beijing Film Academy in 1989. Only a few studios, all state-owned, were allowed to make movies.

articles.headline: A Pivot to China Saved Elon Musk. It Also Binds Him to Beijing.
articles.snippet: Tesla and China built a symbiotic relationship, with credits, workers and parts that made Mr. Musk ultrarich. Now, his reliance on the country may give Beijing leverage.
articles.abstract: Tesla and China built a symbiotic relationship, with credits, workers and parts that made Mr. Musk ultrarich. Now, his reliance on the country may give Beijing leverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Elon Musk unveiled the first Chinese-made Teslas in Shanghai in 2020, he went off script and started dancing. Peeling off his jacket, he flung it across the stage in a partial striptease.
articles.byline: By Mara Hvistendahl, Jack Ewing and John Liu

articles.headline: Israel Deploys Expansive Facial Recognition Program in Gaza
articles.snippet: The experimental effort, which has not been disclosed, is being used to conduct mass surveillance of Palestinians in Gaza, according to military officials and others.
articles.abstract: The experimental effort, which has not been disclosed, is being used to conduct mass surveillance of Palestinians in Gaza, according to military officials and others.
articles.lead_paragraph: Within minutes of walking through an Israeli military checkpoint along Gaza’s central highway on Nov. 19, the Palestinian poet Mosab Abu Toha was asked to step out of the crowd. He put down his 3-year-old son, whom he was carrying, and sat in front of a military jeep.
